actions.text: On agreeing to the Ellison amendment (A026) Failed by recorded vote: 132 - 289, 1 Present (Roll no. 213).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A026) offered by Mr. Ellison.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Ellison amendment (A026) Failed by recorded vote: 132 - 289, 1 Present (Roll no. 213).
Roll call votes on amendments in House
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole

description: Amendment sought to return $9,440,300,000 from procurement to the OCO Operations & Maintenance fund in order to fund operations overseas, with $26 million designated for suicide prevention.
purpose: An amendment numbered 9 printed in House Report 114-571 to reduce funding for base budget procurement items from Overseas Conti ngency Operations (OCO) funds to $1,287,871,000, in accordance with the Presidents request. $9,440,300,000 is transferred to OCO Operations & Maintenance fund in order to fund operations overseas, with $26 million designated for suicide prevention.
